alert.note: Alert for Dawes; Kimball; North Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Hard Freeze Watch issued May 19 at 8:00PM CDT until May 21 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HARD FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 25 degrees possible. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Wyoming and the Western Nebraska Panhandle. This includes Chadron, Douglas, Kimball, Pine Bluffs, and Torrington. * WHEN...Friday evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
